thread.title: German parliament ratifies Greek bailout
thread.title_full: German parliament ratifies Greek bailout - MarketWatch

author: Andrea Thomas
title: German parliament ratifies Greek bailout
text:
BERLIN — The German parliament on Wednesday ratified a new bailout deal for Greece necessary to unlock a much-needed injection of cash, despite considerable skepticism from Chancellor Angela Merkel’s conservative parliamentary group.
Ahead of the vote, Finance Minister Wolfgang Schäuble, long concerned about Greece’s fitness to remain a member of the currency area, told lawmakers that Athens deserved more aid after it accepted the painful economic overhauls and budget cuts attached to the €86 billion ($95 billion) bailout.
The German government’s motion passed 454-113, while 18 abstained. A breakdown of the votes will be provided later Wednesday.
The approval in the Bundestag was a major step toward clearing the final adoption of the bailout by eurozone finance ministers. A first €13 billion payment is expected to take place on Thursday, when Athens faces redemptions on government bonds held by the European Central Bank.
An expanded version of this report appears on WSJ.com
